sentences.sContent: Naomi was only 17 when she got married.
There are only a few cars on the island.
sentences.sCn: 这个岛上只有几辆汽车。

sentences.sContent: ...only after the Yangtze River and the Yellow River...
...it now turns out that exercise can exhaust not only your muscles...
...and until now have only reported minor accidents...
...The river basin is not only the birthplace of the ancient Chinese civilization，but also the most prosperous region in the early history of China...
...The report’s writers state that America’s failure to invest in infrastructure impacts not only the health of the real-estate market...
...you can use it not only in the class but also for the postgraduate entrance examination...

...Team building skills are in short supply: Deloitte reports that only 12% of the executives they contacted feel they understand the way people work together in networks and only 21% feel confident in their ability to build cross-functional teams...
...it not only serves as crucial bridge to build trust and connection between two generations but also exerts a profound and subtle influence toward to children’s personal growth...
...the only way to cure aging is to find ways to repair that damage...

synos.tran: 唯一的，仅有的；最合适的

phrases.pCn: 直到那时（后面的句子要倒装）

trans.tranOther: not more than a particular number, age etc
used to say that there is one person, thing, or group in a particular situation and no others
